text: Consider the following ANSI C code segment: z=x + 3 + y-> fl + y-> f2; for (i = 0; i <200; i=1i+ 2) { if (z > 1) { p=p+x+3; q=gq +y-> fl; } else { p=p+y->f2; q=q+x+ 3; } } Assume that the variable y points to a struct (allocated on the heap) containing two fields f1 and 2, and the local variables x, y, z, p, g, and i are allotted registers. Common sub-expression elimination (CSE) optimization is applied on the code. The number of addition and the dereference operations (of the formy -> f1 or y -> 2) in the optimized code, respectively, are:
